In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Certainly! Here is an example implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(input_string::String; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(input_string)
    wrapped_string = ""
    current_line_length = 0
    
    for word in words
        if current_line_length + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            wrapped_string *= "\n"
            current_line_length = 0
        end
        wrapped_string *= word * " "
        current_line_length += length(word) + 1
    end
    
    return wrapped_string
end

# Example usage
input_str = "Hello there, how are you doing today?"
wrapped_output = wrap_string(input_str, text_width=15)
println(wrapped_output)
```

In this example, the `wrap_string` function takes an input string and iterates over the words, adding a newline character whenever the maximum text width is exceeded. You can change the `text_width` parameter to control the maximum width of each line.
